Reviews.Content: An average 4-star with helpful staff We booked this on ebookers, it worked out at about 拢35 a night with was a bargain. When we eventually arrived, we were put in a room that stank of smoke, despite requesting a non-smoking room. The lady at the desk however, was more than happy to move us to a non-smoking room which was pleasant. A couple of negatives, firstly the smoking room we moved out of had a bath, whilst the non-smoking one didn't - I assume it is luck of the draw. Secondly, no tea/coffee facilities in the room.The hotel is a little way out of the centre. When we arrived, we got off the U5 underground line at 'Glessener Strase', there was then a fair walk to the hotel. I advise definitely taking either the number 30 bus to Friedberger Warte from Konstablerwache (a main U-bahn, S-Bahn interchange), or bus 34 to Friedberger Warte from the stop 'Dornbusch' on the U1, U2 or U3 line. These both take you virtually to the door. Do not be deceived by the front entrance having a restaurant name above the double doors, it is the hotel main reception.The food in the hotel is excellent, breakfast, despite being advertised as continental offered a good selection of hot options. We also had a bar meal in the 'cubes' bar adjacent to reception. The food was excellent in terms of portion, quality and value for money. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but the price list looked reasonable. We tried to eat at the restaurant 'Friedberger Warte' (on the roundabout opposite the hotel). Unfortunately, they were full, but it looked fantastic and very authentic!
Reviews.Author: Tom083

Reviews.Content: Far out but Fantastic I really enjoyed my stay at this Hotel. It was a little far out from the center of Frankfurt but with fantastic directions from the desk staff we were able to take the highly efficient bus service into the center. Breakfast was amazing (all cooked by students of a local culinary school) and the room was spacious and well presented.
Reviews.Author: bostonenglish

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, hard to find My wife and I stayed at this hotel during a trip to the US Consulate. We thought the hotel was very nice. The staff were friendly, the dinner was delicious, and the breakfast buffet was one of the best we've had. The only problem we had was in finding it. If you are coming by car be aware that the hotel address is not in most navigation systems. We were informed by staff that the hotel grounds are on the site of a former US military base and the address can't be plugged into most GPS's. We had a very, very difficult time finding it, and when we called the hotel for help when lost they weren't able to point us in the right direction. We eventually drove to the consulate and drove around the block until we found the hotel. Only other thing of note was that the hotel seems to cater to Russians. There were many, many of them in the breakfast area. No problems, just an observation.
Reviews.Author: callmeishmael

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel for budget traveller Booked the Friedberger Warte on www.1800hotels.com and got 2 nights for 80 Euro. What value it turned out to be, beautiful air conditioned room with shower bath tv etc..If coming from frankfurt airport get the s8 bahn train and stop at Konstablerwache station about 6 stops. Then go up the escalator to the street and take the number 30 bus for friedberger Warte , its about 6 stops on. The hotel is 50 metres from the bus stop.The only downside I had was the german receptionist girl, she had a face and manner I could only describe in English as A face of a Rothweiller after chewing on an onion!.P.S If you booked online they will ask for your credit card and hotel confirmation number at reception, say you havent it with you. Its just to charge you for things like telephone calls etc.
Reviews.Author: harry155

Reviews.Content: staff not helpful if you want to leave hotel Book this hotel because we need a place after arriving from Madrid after leaving Rio, we booked a few months in advance but the hotel was what was said. Although when we made 3 thats right 3 local phone calls from the room we where charge 208euro. Exactly if you read this i warn you that this information is not in the room or in the inroom booklet! the reception told us Quote why did not you ring reception. They charge 10.26euro per minute for a local phone call to the train station.This hotel and the chain are just wrought the customers that use this hotel. the hotel WILL NOT CONTACT YOU if you want to question anything!
Reviews.Author: craig23

Reviews.Content: Perfect I stayed at Hotel Friedberger Warte just for a night so I cant be so informative about it. In my opinion this hotel is perfect. It is located at the outskirts of Frankfurt but since I had a GPS equipped car it was a piece of cake finding it. Actually I chose it because I just wanted a hotel close to the Autobahn and this hotel proved to be a perfect choice. Cheap, clean, big room and nothing special to complain about. Yes it is not a 5 star hotel but in the end you just get much more than the price you pay.
Reviews.Author: xm0000

Reviews.Content: Out of town but easy to reach       double room
Reviews.Author: viajes.papi

Reviews.Content: Good Hotel, but the fine dining resteraunt sucks! This hotel is really good...clean and comfortable beds etc. Don't eat in the fine dining resteraunt! Its really bad....my vegetables were still frozen! YUCK! The bar food is waaaay better and cheaper.
Reviews.Author: TaxidiotisNJ

Reviews.Content: Perfect start to a German holiday       room 212
Reviews.Author: minicooperdownunder

Reviews.Content: Miles away from a 4**** hotel No queen sized bed, no mini bar, almost no internet signal in rooms, no pay TV, no coffee or tee facilities in the room, no yellow pages, no clock radio, no ironing facilities in the room, takes ages front desk to reply or no reply at all, only one phone in the room, pillows size non-standard. Attached restaurant excellent food, bar service very good. Overall very far away from a 4**** hotel.
Reviews.Author: seltringar

Reviews.Content: Comfortable, modern, pleasing We stayed here for 2 nights in early July, when it was rainy. I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable, the breakfast generous and tasty (coffee also), and the staff polite and helpful (and English-speaking!) if not effusive. Wireless is available in the rooms, but costs E5 per hour, the same as using internet in the business center downstairs. It is located a bit outside the city center, but buses run regularly during the day and we never found that to be a problem. I'll stay here again when I'm in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: limehotcheeto

Reviews.Content: Nice and clean Ok average hotel. No tea or coffee facilities in the room. We got a nice cot for baby. We got b  b but breakfast was just ok. Mcdonalds just located down the road. Very clean but lacked atmosphere.
Reviews.Author: PCorduff

Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the 2 nights I stayed there...they have AC!! I booked 2 rooms, one for my Dad and one for my wife and I. We had a really nice stay. I was extremely impressed with the fact that this hotel actually has AC. Needless to say, I did not realize this until we spent the next week in extremely hot conditions in Giessen, Wetzlar and Heidelberg. So, if you want to stay in a nice hotel that is welcoming to come back to, I suggest you book a night. Also, if you have a chance go directly across the street to the little resturant next to Ollies. The owner will treat you better then anywhere I have ever eaten in the states. Enjoy.....BTW drink some Bitburger beer...yum
Reviews.Author: rjmelander

Reviews.Content: Unfriendly Manager and front desk Staff! Stayed 5 nights over a 3 week period and the Manager never smiles or says Hello to anyone that I observed. His front desk Staff follows his lead with the same unfriendly attitude as well as a Young Woman who works in the lounge area and seems to really dislike everyone and everything about her job. Perhaps working with computers would suit her better. The Dining room Staff and our Housekeeper were fine.It is a lovely Hotel with a very good breakfast but even if you have a non smoking room, the smoke from the open areas and lobby find there way throughout this Hotel. It is a real shame to have this 2nd hand smoke around you each time you leave your room.Additionally, at breakfast, there is an assortment of complimentary German Newspapers on a table in the dining room, however, if you want a newspaper in English (USA Today), they are on the reception desk and they charge you for them. It seems rather discriminatory to me. They have enough English speaking people staying at the Hotel to put a few English language newspapers in the breakfast area as well.I would not stay again because of the smoke and the many unfriendly people working at the Hotel
Reviews.Author: 1Clayton

Reviews.Content: Covered the Basics I stayed one night at this hotel, after getting a cheap deal through a website. Although this hotel is modern and clean, for me it just covered the basics and was disappointing.The hotel is a bit out of town: to get there take S-Bahn 8 until Konstablerwache stop (about 6 stops) then take bus 30 (direction north) 7 stops to Friedberger Warte stop. The fare was E3.55 one way, E8.40 for an all day ticket or E13.70 for a group all day ticket for up to 5 people (best value if 2 or more are travelling!).Check-in time for the hotel is 3pm, however they state on their website and in their hotel guide that they will try to accommodate early arrivals. We arrived in the morning after a long flight, but still could not get our room until 3pm. The check-in process was fast and efficient and the staff all spoke English very well. We had booked a double room, but were given a twin. The room was clean and newly furnished, but had no tv, fridge or tea/coffee facilities. The bathroom was well sized and included a hairdryer.We had dinner at the hotel bistro - I would not recommend a meal here, the food was plain and uninspiring. The complimentary buffet breakfast, however was fantastic. There was a huge selection of hot and cold food which was all delicious.
Reviews.Author: Turkeyjay

Reviews.Content: Great hotel, a little off the beaten path This was a wonderful hotel. The location is not near the rail station or the airport. I would guess mostly business travelers stay here. The hotel is very modern and clean. By the time we got to Frankfurt it was very hot and humid. The AC was a welcome releif. Wonderful breakfast, the best we had in Germany. An exceptional find if you are willing to stay out of the city center.
Reviews.Author: Picky_Traveler1

Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, yet away from the center of Frankfurt We stayed at the Freidberger Warte for one night for the price was too good to pass up. A hot buffet breakfast was included in the price. This is an up scale hotel and the accomodations were excellent. The only thing we didn't like was the location. We like to stay within walking distance to the center of a city and even though the bus stop was close by as well as the subway, we thought this hotel was a bit out of the way. If you want to walk to the hotel from the main train station, it' s an hour and 20 minute walk. There were two restaurants on the premises and we only at ate one of them for breakfast which was very good. For dinner we decided to walk across the street to the old historic Friedberger Warte restaurant. A traditional German dinner served outside in their courtyard. Just head towards the lookout tower. Excellent hotel and staff.
Reviews.Author: HBHW

Reviews.Content: excellent value       twin beds
Reviews.Author: jhwt

Reviews.Content: Great location and accomodations       Cologne Cathedral
Reviews.Author: bamagirl2

Reviews.Content: Brand New Designer Hotel I agree with most of the other happy people who have stayed in this hotel. The Hotel Friedberger Warte was a wonderful surprise after a booking at the last minute. My family arrived, tried and stressed, and even though the hotel isnt in the middle of Frankfurt, we had the best stay of all the hotels in Germany!Brand new hotel and everything is detailed wonderfully (important since I'm a designer). All the furnishings and fittings were brand new, modern and well planned. The rooms, beds, common areas etc. were all VERY clean and fresh. Free wi-fi hotel wide and conferance facilities were fantastic!the helpful and English speaking hotel staff helped me with a simple 5-10 minute bus ride to the center of the city (for shopping), and even the maids were friendly and smiling. The bar staff were also lovely, and helped us in everyway they could!The breakfast was WONDERFUL (for a European breakfast) since it鈥檚 the site of a culinary school. We also ate dinner and lunch in the restraunt and it had a wide range of really good meals at a reasonable price. The sauna and gym was very accessible, clean and modern. When I go back to Frankfurt I'm staying here again, without a doubt!
Reviews.Author: australian_mel

Reviews.Content: Absolutely fabulous! Agree with all the compliments given to this hotel by the previous reviewers. It was fantastic, spotless, quiet, courteous, wonderful breakfast. I will most definitely stay here again if ever again in Frankfurt. The rate I got from Octopus Travel for this hotel was a steal.The directions given on the travel websites were not optimal. I recommend taking the S8 (from the Regional Trains terminal at the airport) all the way to Konstablerwache station and then hopping on bus 30 going north 7 stops to the Friedberger Warte stop. Altogether 3.35Euro from the airport to the hotel (or get a day pass for 7.40Euro if you expect to take more than two more trips in the city that day).A tip regarding lockers, if you should need them in Frankfurt: there were no lockers in Terminal 1, only a couple of full-service baggage storage facilities. 3.50Euro per 24 hours. There are self-service lockers at the main train station (1Euro small, 2Euro large) and at Hauptwache station (1.50Euro) -- but they were ALL occupied!
Reviews.Author: zbenye

Reviews.Content: looks fab   showReview(6151876, 'full');

Reviews.Content: great value and service   showReview(6130928, 'full');
